p.s: The excerpt of the speech at the European American Chamber of Commerce spoken by Michel Barnier in New York at the 10 July in 2018 about the consequences of the Brexit and how the European Union wants to build a financial relationship with the United Kingdom.
In the following text I am first going to point out the consequences of Brexit, as well as the caracteristicscharacteristics of a close relationship between the UK and the EU.
Secondly I am want to analyse the text by looking at his line of arguments, his choice of words and the stylistic devices he uses.
The first concequenceconsequence that he names is caused by the decision from the UK ot leave the European Single Market (l. 4-5).
He says that this is going to have a big influence on the value chains and the trading (l. 5-6).
Also it is going to have a really big impact in the particular manufacturing, logistics, agricultural and food sectors (l. 7-8).
Also he thinks that the Brexit is a lose-lose situation for both sides because the costs will be very high (l. 8-10).
An other consequence is for the buisinessesbusinesses.
He says that they should analyse their exposure to the other side and be ready to adapt their logistical channels, supply chains and existing contracts (l. 11-13).
There could also be a no deal wichwhich would be worse (l. 13-14).
In his opinion the EU and the UK have a close relationship in a fincancial way (l. 15, 16).
Therefore the EU might have to open the Single Market to third countryscountries (l. 16-17).
This financial relationship and the market should be based on the Free Trade Agreement, where the UK should follow the EU rules (l. 20-21).
